intro: Tetranthera verticillata, commonly known as the clustered tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tetranthera verticillata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
